data.title: Great place
data.text: Great atmosphere and food.   Lunch specials and service that gets you in and out in an hour or less.  The staff is extremely friendly.   Come visit and see for yourself.

data.title: Kind welcome, great food
data.text: We were not the customers they expected on a recent Thursday night. After moving a kid into Guilford College, we stopped by for dinner. We didn't know it was primarily a bar until we showed up. It's primarily a bar. I asked the server if we could still get a table and dinner for our collection of small child, parents, and grandparents. She was immediately welcoming and full of yes. She found us a quiet spot in a different dining area from the bar, and went above and beyond to make us comfortable. As an added bonus, the food was excellent. It was all very fresh, with generous portions. If we didn't have parents and child with us, Husband and I would have liked to hang out for several hours and several drinks. It seems like a very cool local place.

data.title: Ok food & poor service
data.text: I've had lunch here about a half dozen times.  The food has been ok but they really provide "no" service.  I usually go as a last resort.

data.title: A great place for after work
data.text: I met 3 friends here after work for dinner and drinks. It was the perfect start to the weekend.  The wings are huge and so good.  Chips, tots, or fries, you can't go wrong either way.  Great selection of beers.  Good beer specials.

data.title: Solid Bar
data.text: Went for a late evening cocktail and wings. Food was fantastic and the music was solid. In addition, the location is very convenient when staying downtown.

data.title: Decent bar
data.text: I went here with a few friends one night since it's close to our apartment. It's a decent bar. We got a table and the waitress kept forgetting to check in on us, but other than that it was pretty good. At like 10pm they had a live DJ but no one was really dancing. A lot of different people come here (underage, young adults, parents, etc..). Also they very rarely check IDs! Beers were a little pricer than I would have liked.

data.title: Super friendly bartenders
data.text: Fun establishment with super friendly bartenders, full menu, pool table and feber. They have good deals on food on different days.

data.title: Great intro to Greensboro
data.text: We stopped in for a bite and a couple of beers after arriving in town. The bartenders were so helpful in helping us select from the local beers and making sure we were happy with our choices. It was a great introduction to the area! The food was good, too.

data.title: A fun night downtown Greensboro
data.text: This was a nice place for a couple drinks and an appetizer.  We had the chicken nachos and cheese sticks.  The staff was very friendly.  Would visit again.

data.title: Will not be returning
data.text: Went for an after hours social and decided to have dinner afterwards. What a mistake. I ordered a burger "No Bun"- medium well. Well it came out with a bun and was pretty much rare . The utilizes they gave you would not even cut into water much less a burger. If you are going to use disposable (which I am ok with) then UPGRADE to something that will at least cut into something. I would have sent my burger back but at that point out waitperson was no where to be found. She finally made it back in time to give us our check. I waited tables for years and If I saw where someone had not eaten their food I would ask what was the problem and would have made it right. You got some work to do folks....

data.title: Cute name for a bar/restaurant- very friendly staff
data.text: We were downtown to visit a gallery, and 'stumbled' upon this place and decided to stop in for lunch- the staff was very friendly- and even gave us a free appetizer because we were celebrating three birthdays!  Thank you!  We all enjoyed our lunch choices- we would go back again if in the area-  Typical bar decor......

data.title: Cheese and beer
data.text: Went here with my son to watch a UFC ppv. Really enjoyed that here. No cover or drink minimum. We got there a little early and got grilled cheese sandwiches. Three kinds of cheese and rye bread which was pretty surprising considering this place is quite unassuming. But the real surprise was the tater tots. Done with cheese or chili if you want. It was like grown up tots. I had them plain, nice and crispy outside, soft inside, not too salty or anything. Well stocked bar, reasonably priced drinks and beer. They also have home made potato chips. Warm and served with cool ranch dressing, they go great with a cold beer and watching MMA. A great neighborhood place with character but very chill place to hang.

data.title: Cold beer! Hot wings!
data.text: What's not to love about a bar that has cold beer and hot wings? The beer selection is a healthy mix of craft, local, and old favorites. The menu is a mix of bar food and some unique spins on some old classics. The staff is great. The owners are terrific and will come hang out with you and chat you up. This is a great, cornerstone dive bar that is under appreciated in this city.

data.title: great lunch. cold tea
data.text:
luv this place
Chris and Trevor are fun hosts
Near Beautiful Downtown Greensboro 
come visit soon and you will enjoy this spot

data.title: Found this place during my trip to FolkFest 2015
data.text: First it is my kind of place but I could do without the college kid screaming at the TV in a drunken attempt to sway the line judges during the first NFL game of the season. And i like what one post said about the waitress looking like prostitutes in training! LOL! If the owner hadn't came over and taken my order they may still be adjusting their bra and scratchin their tattoo covered tails and talkin about how wiped out they are! TV's great, Food was pretty good!

data.title: Wedding Weekend
data.text: Popped in on the way back to our hotel after a friend's wedding reception.  Great place! There was a band.  Wished I could have stayed longer, but friends were waiting for us. Will definitely go again if I find myself back in Greensboro!

data.title: Not impressed - maybe an off day?
data.text:
Had heard decent things about Stumble Stilskins - so rounded up a group of us and decided to try it out for lunch.

It took over half an hour to get any service at our table and another half our for the food to come out. Unfortunately out of a group of 8 - only one of us felt our meal was worth coming back for. 

Probably won't go back - unless for drinks in the evening- as there are a lot of other places in town that I feel are better than Stumble's.

data.title: Great local bar with laid back atmo
data.text: Visiting Greensboro on biz. Found this place by recommendation from hotel. Owner visited with us to talk sports and made us feel very welcome. Great burgers and if you hate chains, you'll love this place. Highly recommended!

data.title: Huge sandwiches very good
data.text: Has the bulldog see pictures very very good and very fulling worth the weight in gold a must stop if in the area also had great beer specials a great place hang out

data.title: Who dreamt up the menu?
data.text: the bulldog, pastrami AND corned beef was one of the best tasting Samir's I've ever had. Be sure to get the "chips" as a side. Talk about surprising!
